intro: Aegiphila setiformis, commonly known as the hairy leaf germander, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is characterized by its aromatic, hairy leaves and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. Aegiphila setiformis is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
